memberdef.name: Add

briefdescription.para: Adds the given item to the given position.

simplesect.para: A valid pointer if the item was successfully placed at the given position, or NULL if something was already there.

memberdef.name: Add

briefdescription.para: Adds the given item to the given position.

simplesect.para: A valid pointer if the item was successfully placed at the given position, or NULL if something was already there.

briefdescription.para: Adds the given item to the given position.

simplesect.para: A valid pointer if the item was successfully placed at the given position, or NULL if something was already there.

briefdescription.para: Look at all items and see if any intersect (or would overlap) the given item.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if so, false if there would be no overlap. If an excludeItem is given then it will not be checked for intersection, for example it may be the item we are checking the position of.

briefdescription.para: Look at all items and see if any intersect (or would overlap) the given item.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if so, false if there would be no overlap. If an excludeItem is given then it will not be checked for intersection, for example it may be the item we are checking the position of.

briefdescription.para: Find the sizer item for the given window or subsizer, returns NULL if not found.
Find the sizer item for the given window or subsizer, returns NULL if not found.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true on success. If the move is not allowed (because an item is already there) then false is returned.

briefdescription.para: Constructor, with optional parameters to specify the gap between the rows and columns.
Called when the managed size of the sizer is needed or when layout needs done.
Return the sizer item located at the point given in pt, or NULL if there is no item at that point.

detaileddescription.para: The (x,y) coordinates in pt correspond to the client coordinates of the window using the sizer for layout. (non-recursive)

briefdescription.para: Return the sizer item for the given grid cell, or NULL if there is no item at that position.
Return the sizer item that has a matching user data (it only compares pointer values) or NULL if not found.
Get the size of the specified cell, including hgap and vgap.

detaileddescription.para: Only valid after window layout has been performed.

briefdescription.para: Get the size used for cells in the grid with no item.
Called when the managed size of the sizer is needed or when layout needs done.
Set the size used for cells in the grid with no item.

A wxSizer that can lay out items in a virtual grid like a wxFlexGridSizer but in this case explicit positioning of the items is allowed using wxGBPosition, and items can optionally span more than one row and/or column using wxGBSpan.
